text: Michel Boujenah (born 3 November 1952) is a French-Tunisian actor, director, comedian and screenwriter. He won a César Award in 1986 for his role as Michel in Three Men and a Cradle. He is Jewish."BDS movement’s campaign against Jewish comedian is anti-Semitism, Tunisian watchdog says", JTA (30 June 2017). ==References== Category:1952 births Category:Living people Category:Tunisian movie actors Category:Tunisian screenwriters Category:French movie actors Category:French television actors Category:French stage actors Category:French comedians Category:French screenwriters Category:French movie directors Category:Actors from Tunis Category:French Jews Category:Writers from Tunis Category:Tunisian television actors
title: Michel Boujenah
